intro: Phoebe spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf phoebe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves and small, white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
